Jake Hoyt.Action: Shows gentle consideration toward his wife and infant, noting her presence and expressing concern.
Responds appreciatively when wife playfully reminds him not to forget his police baton.
Focused on his police preparation and career ambitions, without apparent irritation or selfishness.
Kisses his wife affectionately before leaving.
Expresses gratitude to Alonzo for the opportunity to join the unit.
Silently internalizes self-doubt about his appearance.
Passively accepts Alonzo’s indirect and commanding tone without pushback.
Shoves his gun belt in the duffel, zips it shut, grabs pressed uniform and police hat, then heads to the door promptly.
Steels himself and answers the phone calmly when Alonzo calls, responding respectfully and without hesitation.
Does not question Alonzo's unusual instruction to skip roll call and meet at a coffee shop in civvies with extra equipment; instead, accepts it immediately.
Snuggles up to Lisa to relax, engages in playful, affectionate behavior.
Politely greets Alonzo with 'Good morning, sir' and thanks the waitress sincerely.
Waves away the waitress's offer for a menu and refuses food politely.
Offers to get food after interrupting Alonzo, showing some consideration.
Pours an excessive amount of sugar into his coffee, possibly indicating nervousness but not interacting with others warmly.
Talks about his training with Debbie Maxwell, recognizing her competence despite potential bias from Alonzo.
Tries to engage Alonzo by telling a story to entertain him despite discomfort.
Carefully answers Alonzo's questions without confrontation, showing patience and politeness.
Thinks quickly to come up with a relevant story about his probation experience when challenged.
Fidgets nervously and seems unsure at the start of the conversation.
Provides clear and detailed storytelling about the DUI stop, showing awareness of key details.
Arrests a dangerous DUI suspect who was about to commit murder, proud of preventing a crime.
Responds honestly to Alonzo about having a wife, implying fidelity and respect.
Remains crushed but does not retaliate when Alonzo makes a crude sexual comment.
Carries out a traffic stop that uncovers multiple weapons and large quantities of meth, leading to the arrest of a dangerous criminal and preventing a likely murder.
Responds honestly and appropriately when teased about not pursuing casual relationships, indicating self-control and personal discipline.
Feels crushed and embarrassed after Alonzo mocks him, showing vulnerability but no clear loss of professional focus.
Passively follows Alonzo's lead without asserting himself or questioning, such as when getting into the 'G-RIDE' without hesitation.
Jake reacts positively and smiles when Alonzo raises the G-Ride by hydraulics, showing appreciation for the coolness of the moment.
Jake nods and smiles in agreement when Alonzo warns him not to trust the radios or reveal their real locations, showing trust and receptiveness.
Jake makes an observational comment about the crowds and the gang signs he sees without judgment or hostility, demonstrating tolerance and openness.
Responds appropriately to Alonzo's instructions about radio security and procedure, nods and smiles, indicating understanding.
Uses correct police radio protocol to check in with Dispatch ('Nora fifteen, ten-eight').
Observes and identifies gang signs and illegal activities around him.
Initially asks where the office is, seeming unfamiliar with the setup (G-Ride and area).
Smiles when mentioning his nine-month-old daughter.
Avoids talking about his family when Alonzo probes personal boundaries.
Shows anger and clenched teeth when Alonzo makes inappropriate comments about his wife.
Responds appropriately to Alonzo's question about his Spanish skills with 'Mas o menos' and agrees to work on it.
Engages in conversation with Alonzo without losing composure despite provocative and disrespectful comments about his family.
Shows anger but restrains himself when Alonzo makes personal and inappropriate remarks.
Appears somewhat naive or inexperienced, asking if Alonzo will teach him old style police aggression, showing he may not fully understand the environment he is entering.
Accepts the Chaplain's card and responds appreciatively.
Engages in casual conversation with Alonzo, showing curiosity without hostility.
Accepts the chaplain's card from Alonzo and says he will call him, showing openness to guidance and support.
Asks who 'Mr. Clean' is after hearing it from a detective, indicating curiosity and willingness to gather information.
Listens attentively to Alonzo's explanation about Neto and the neighborhood, showing engagement and learning.
Observes the hand-to-hand drug deal and confirms it to Alonzo.
Follows Alonzo's lead during the vehicle stop, drawing his gun and giving commands clearly and confidently.
Complies with Alonzo's order to stay off the radio and puts away his Motorola.
Addresses the suspects clearly, instructing them where to put their hands and to look ahead without faltering.
Orders the girl to put her palms on the glass to control the situation, indicating an attempt to maintain order without escalating fear.
Passively follows Alonzo's aggressive commands without intervening or showing empathy toward the scared kids.
Commands the girl to put her palms on the glass to control the suspect as Alonzo directs the situation.
Fails to directly intervene or assert control over the escalating situation dominated by Alonzo.
Reacted to girl’s look of revulsion, showing discomfort with the treatment of kids.
Questions Alonzo about the harsh treatment of students.
Refuses to smoke marijuana offered by Alonzo, stating he became a cop to keep people from using poison.
Smiles to himself when Alonzo compliments his moves (self-amusement).
Questions the legitimacy of Alonzo's aggressive tactics on students and expresses discomfort with corrupt behavior.
Listens and learns carefully from Alonzo's detailed explanation of narcotics quality, showing attentiveness and ability to absorb knowledge.
Refuses to smoke marijuana despite Alonzo's pressure, citing concern for his job; demonstrates moral conviction but also potential inflexibility in a precarious situation.
Refuses to take a hit initially, standing firm on his personal boundaries around drugs.
Engages in a staring contest and eventually takes a hit to maintain rapport with Alonzo despite discomfort.
Blows smoke intentionally in Alonzo's face after coughing, engaging playfully with him.
Stands firm, shakes his head refusing to take drugs despite pressure.
Engages in a staring contest and takes hits from the pipe to keep up with Alonzo, despite being visibly affected and coughing.
Blows smoke in Alonzo's face, showing a bit of defiance and confidence.
Clearly messed up and head lolling from side to side after taking multiple hits, showing inexperience and vulnerability.
Expresses horror and fear upon being drugged unknowingly, panics about consequences.
Shows vulnerability and sincerity through panic and openly admitting his distress.
Does not retaliate or escalate after being physically struck by Alonzo.
Follows Alonzo without questioning much, appearing overwhelmed and submissive.
Is horrified and panics after being unknowingly drugged; expresses fear about a drug test and job security.
Tries to calm down and claims to be 'cool' despite clear distress.
Seeks advice on what to say before meeting Roger, showing uncertainty.
Does not join the toast, quietly drinks and winces, and is somewhat reserved in the social setting.
Responds politely and sincerely to Roger's questions about his background, showing openness and straightforwardness.
Jake looks around the room, studying his environment rather than participating in the social drinking ritual.
Jake takes a sip of the offered drink despite wincing, showing willingness to follow orders despite discomfort.
Jake recoils when Roger tugs his goatee, signaling some social awkwardness or discomfort with informal physical contact.
Jake's behavior is noted by Roger as possibly being under the influence (implied by 'high as a motherfucker'), undermining his perceived professional competence.
Laughs sincerely at a dark joke but also expresses discomfort, showing emotional honesty.
Expresses belief that life is 'all smiles and cries' and emphasizes the importance of controlling emotions, showing sensitivity and insight.
Engages openly in conversation with Roger and Alonzo, showing willingness to connect and learn.
Laughs genuinely at a dark joke, shows emotional intelligence and insight by interpreting the joke's meaning related to the street.
Expresses confidence in understanding the streets and articulates a balanced perspective on controlling emotions.
Engages in banter despite being called 'greenhorn' and 'too high,' showing some calmness but possibly underestimating complexity.
Accepts a cigarette from Alonzo despite discomfort, tries to maintain composure.
Shows physical weakness (vomiting) after smoking, but apologizes sincerely.
Responds honestly about his ethnic background when asked.
Rejects the cigarette by throwing it out the window after initial acceptance.
Accepts a cigarette offered by Alonzo despite discomfort, tries to maintain composure after vomiting, wipes his face and claims he's cool.
Recognizes that accepting the cigarette was a mistake and promptly reacts by vomiting, showing physical intolerance.
Jokes lightly with Alonzo when weak and dizzy, maintaining a friendly tone despite discomfort.
Shows open interest in the people around him (notably admiring the woman pushing a baby carriage) with no apparent judgment.
Keeps eyes closed and unresponsive when Alonzo urges him to stay awake, showing vulnerability but no hostility or resistance.
Maintains composure despite dizziness and alcohol influence; tries to stay alert and respond to Alonzo.
Jokes about who Alonzo is while clearly impaired and dazed.
Drops his beer, soaking his leg, showing clumsiness under pressure.
Immediately reacts to potential danger to protect a schoolgirl, attempts an arrest despite being outmatched physically.
Uses a choke hold that is described as forbidden and resorts to violent takedown tactics during fight.
Violently restrains Crackheads to protect the Schoolgirl.
Asks the Schoolgirl if she is okay and if she is hurt, showing concern.
Intends to get the Schoolgirl's statement instead of immediately arresting suspects, showing some consideration.
Expresses shock at Alonzo's casual approach to releasing suspects without arrests.
Quickly and effectively subdues Crackhead #1 using physical skills, applies cuffs promptly, showing tactical and physical competence.
Pins Crackhead #2 and cuffs him efficiently, demonstrating preparedness (flexicuffs in sock) and decisiveness.
Asks the schoolgirl if she is okay, showing awareness and concern, indicating situational competence beyond just physical confrontation.
Wants to get the schoolgirl's statement despite Alonzo advising against making arrests, showing procedural conscientiousness and adherence to duty.
Appears shocked at Alonzo's suggestion to 'kick 'em loose', possibly indicating some naivety or less streetwise understanding.
Expresses desire to get criminals off the street by using a punching bag, indicating a non-violent but firm stance.
Takes pity on Crackhead #1 and walks away instead of escalating violence.
Passively allows Alonzo to brutalize Crackhead #1 and Crackhead #2 without intervening.
Glares at the Crackheads who threaten a 14-year-old girl and verbally defends her, calling out their predatory behavior.
Turns and walks away instead of escalating violence or confrontation despite provocation.
Refuses to accept a beer offered by Alonzo, demonstrating some self-control or refusal to join potentially problematic behavior.
States he prefers booking bad guys rather than beating them, indicating a preference for lawful and less violent methods.
Rejects Alonzo's cynical justification of violent street justice, showing sincerity and idealism about true justice.
Stops and picks up the schoolgirl's change purse and ID, demonstrating attention to evidence.
Glares at the crackheads and vocally protests the exploitation of a minor, showing moral awareness and assertiveness.
Turns and walks away instead of escalating conflict, avoiding unnecessary violence or trouble.
Refuses Alonzo's offer of beer and illicit money, showing self-control and ethical standards.
Insists on booking bad guys rather than resorting to violence, demonstrating preference for lawful, procedural work.
Runs alone into a dangerous alley filled with drug addicts, showing poor tactical judgment and risking safety.
Questions Alonzo's methods and challenges his approach to justice.
Refuses to smoke crack despite peer pressure.
Accepts praise from Alonzo for having fire and doing the right thing.
Admits to using a prohibited choke hold when he was losing the fight.
Smiles and clinks cans with Alonzo, engages in friendly toast.
Acknowledges Alonzo's work anniversary and congratulates him sincerely.
Shows understanding and respect towards Alonzo’s past experiences.
Admits to breaking procedure but explains it was to avoid harm.
Receives positive feedback from Alonzo who applauds his situational awareness ('magic eye') and intelligence ('up your street IQ').
Shows understanding of the environment and gang conflict when discussing graffiti and ongoing gang war.
Mentions having a six-year-old Rottweiler who's good with his kid, showing care for both his pet and family.
Gawks at the crime scene, indicating shock or unfamiliarity rather than composed professionalism.
Gawks at the crime scene, showing surprise or shock.
Responds knowledgeably about his own dog when Alonzo asks about dogs.
Expresses shock and disapproval upon hearing about racist police behavior ('That's fucked-up. That's one of the most whacked things I ever heard.')

Almost quit when hearing about racially charged violence, showing initial hesitation but does not leave the job.
Questions Alonzo about the harsh reality he observes, demonstrating awareness and thoughtfulness.

Successfully tackles and cuffs the dealer after he tries to flee, demonstrating physical capability and quick reaction.
Follows Alonzo's instructions to put his hood up and engage, showing willingness to adapt but limited initiative.
Refuses to collect evidence contaminated with vomit and crack, expressing concern about legality and ethics.

Tells Sandman's Wife repeatedly to sit down and be quiet in a firm manner.

Withholds the warrant copy from Sandman's Wife, citing his partner has it instead of cooperating transparently.

Expresses discomfort and disapproval: 'That wasn't cool. That wasn't cool at all.' after being shot at.

Accuses Alonzo of being a rogue cop, displaying moral integrity.
Shows worry and repents after aggressive actions, indicating conscience and sincerity.

Expresses worry and repentance after realizing he may be involved in misconduct.
Shows hesitation and uncertainty about Alonzo's methods and the consequences.

Shows wariness or hesitation around gangsters, indicating caution but no judgment or disrespect shown.

Asks Alonzo if his family gets love besides material things, showing concern beyond surface-level needs.

Engages in casual, light banter with Alonzo; asks questions about Alonzo's family showing attentiveness.

Makes a potentially provocative comment about Alonzo's family (love for children), risking tension with Alonzo.

Expresses frustration and confusion by saying 'You can't just spring this shit on me. I never signed up for this,' revealing a momentary lack of preparedness for unexpected violent confrontations.

Leaning against a phone pole, watching Alonzo handle the incident report, appearing tense and on the verge of freaking out.

Appears tormented and has a lump in his throat, showing emotional vulnerability and possible wavering confidence.

Shows emotional vulnerability by appearing heartbroken and trapped when looking into Alonzo's eyes.
Shares personal hardships, revealing missed meals and difficult upbringing.

Casts wary sideways glances when surrounded by gangsters, showing caution and awareness of the danger.
Engages in physical confrontation with a dominant adversary (Alonzo) instead of trying to escape or de-escalate.
Refuses to kill Alonzo immediately despite the pressure and tension.
Shoots Alonzo in the leg to incapacitate rather than kill.
Maintains composure and coolness under pressure with a pistol at his side, facing a threatening Alonzo calmly.
Acknowledges Alonzo's madness and hesitation with the gun, showing situational awareness.
Decides not to shoot Alonzo between the eyes initially, showing hesitation or moral conflict.
Shoots Alonzo in the thigh at the right moment to incapacitate rather than kill, demonstrating tactical skill and decisiveness.
Refuses to give money to Alonzo, asserting ownership as evidence and rejecting corruption.
Smirks at Alonzo's predicament and takes his badge, explicitly stating 'You don't deserve this.'
Observes the crowd's approval and leaves calmly after standing up to Alonzo.
Slaps Alonzo's badge on the trunk to show he does not claim it and asserts ownership of his integrity.
Tells the officers to leave him alone in a firm but non-aggressive manner.
Calmly retrieves his service weapon, approaches and confronts Lou, Doug, and Stan at his home with clarity and asserts boundaries firmly.
Limping and battered, showing physical vulnerability but still maintains composure and delivers a strong verbal dismissal.
